cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 105 (Thursday, June 15, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GOSAR:H.J. Res. 74.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IThe single subject of this legislation is:To end the extended national emergnecy related to Yemendeclared in 2012[Page H2961]

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 27 - 393 (Roll no. 335). (text: CR H3664)
Failed of passage/not agreed to in House On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 27 - 393 (Roll no. 335). (text: CR H3664)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H3682-3683)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. J. Res. 74, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Gosar demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous order of the House.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the previous order of the House of July 13, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H. J. Res. 74.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. (consideration: CR H3664-3666)
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.

ORDER OF PROCEDURE - Mr. Nunn (IA) asked unanimous consent that it be in order at any time through July 20, 2023, to consider the following joint resolutions in the House if called up by the Chair of the Committee on Foreign Affairs or his designee: H. J. Res. 68, H. J. Res. 70, H. J. Res. 71, or H. J. Res. 74; that each such joint resolution be considered as read; that the previous question be considered as ordered on each such joint resolution to final passage without intervening motion except for debate as follows: for H. J. Res. 68, 30 minutes equally divided among and controlled by Mr. McCaul, Mr. Meeks, and Mrs. Boebert or their respective designees; for H. J. Res. 70 and H. J. Res. 74, 30 minutes equally divided among and controlled by Mr. McCaul, Mr. Meeks, and Mr. Gosar or their respective designees; for H. J. Res. 71, 30 minutes equally divided among and controlled by Mr. McCaul, Mr. Meeks, and Mr. Crane or their respective designees; and that the provisions of section 202 of the National Emergencies Act (50 U .S.C. 1622) shall not apply to each such jo int resolution through July 20, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

cdata.text: This joint resolution terminates the national emergency declared by President Barack Obama on May 16, 2012, which blocks the property of certain persons threatening the peace, security, or stability of Yemen.

bill.title: Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 16, 2012.

item.title: Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 16, 2012.
Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 16, 2012.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
